title: Robbie Williams is rejoining Take That
text:
News Robbie Williams is rejoining Take That The pop superstar will take to the stage with Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen for the final of Let It Shine Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Adorable gran is super excited to see Robbie Williams Share this video     
Pop superstar Robbie Williams is rejoining Take That for the final of Let It Shine. 
The Angels and Come Undone singer will take to the stage with his former bandmates Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen to perform one of their greatest hits on the BBC1 talent search show. 
The 43-year-old will also take on the role of guest judge alongside his pal Gary, singer Dannii Minogue and Spandau Ballet star Martin Kemp as they decide which band will be crowned the winners of the series which pays homage to the Manchester manband. 
Robbie, who famously left Take That in 1995 to launch a hugely successful solo career, said: “I’m looking forward to being back with Gary, Mark and Howard on Let It Shine and am excited to be a guest judge for the very special final.” 
After leaving Take That Robbie became one of the biggest selling artists of all time and the best-selling British solo artist with over 70 million records sold worldwide. 
Now based in Los Angeles with his wife Ayda Field and their children Teddy and Charlton Valentine, he rejoined Take That in 2010 for their Progress album and tour which played eight nights at the Etihad before leaving the band for a second time - although it was made clear that the door was open for him to rejoin in the future. Robbie left the original Take That line-up in 1995 
Robbie, Gary, Howard and Mark will perform together - without former bandmate Jason Orange who left Take That in 2014 - on Saturday, February 25 during the final of the contest to find a band to perform the music of Take That in a new musical. 
Robbie, who released his 11th studio album The Heavy Entertainment Show last year, is performing at the Etihad Stadium in June as part of a huge stadium tour next year. 
Take That will also be on tour from May with their new album Wonderland, released on March 17. They release the new single Giants on Friday. Robbie Williams at Key 103 Christmas Live (Photo: Shirlaine Forrest / Getty) 
This Saturday former Pussycat Doll Ashley Roberts will be a guest judge for the semi-final at 6.55pm. 
The opening performance will see the remaining bands each perform a classic Take That hit, before they are joined on stage for a very special collaboration with Take That themselves to perform the song Shine. The two bands with the lowest public votes will each perform a classic Beatles song and Gary, Dannii, Martin and Ashley will then decide which five boys will carry on as a band to the grand finale of Let It Shine. 
Three bands will take part in the final which will be ultimately decided by viewers. Read More
